intro: Mesopanax proteus, commonly known as the giant arrowleaf, is a unique plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves that can reach up to three meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Araliaceae and is notable for its striking, arrow-shaped leaflets. Mesopanax proteus is a climbing shrub that uses its tendrils to support itself among the dense canopy. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
